Wearing the visage of [taiga giants](/Monsters.aspx?ID=680), taiga yais generally travel in a solitary fashion, always yearning for new experiences and destinations. They are zealous in their love of nature in its purest form and gleefully destroy any established civilizations that they encounter before continuing onwards. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 34 **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Taiga Yai](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1405) **Source** [Pathfinder #167: Ready? Fight!](/Sources.aspx?ID=86) pg. 81 **Perception** +30; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +29, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +26, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +27, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +30, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +32 **Str** +6 **Dex** +8 **Con** +8 **Int** +5 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +6 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=77)_ (20 arrows) --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +27 **Ref** +29 **Will** +30 +1 status on all saves vs. magic **HP** 270 , regeneration 15 (deactivated by fire) **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)**
**Botanic Interruption** ([evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Trigger** The taiga yai is standing in natural foliage or undergrowth and is targeted by a melee attack; **Effect** The taiga yai infuses their power within the plants around them, causing the plants to shoot up and create a protective barrier. The taiga yai gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack roll. If the attack misses, the attacker must attempt a DC 33 Reflex save. On a failed save, the attacker is [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1 round as the plants grab hold of them; on a critical failure, the attacker is also knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). --- **Speed** 40 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** fist +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+12 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid **Ranged** acid missile +29 ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 3d8+10 acid plus [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) for 1 round **Ranged** _shortbow_ +31 ([deadly 2d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d6 piercing **Primal Innate Spells** DC 34 - **2nd** [Entangle](/Spells.aspx?ID=103) (at will), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will; self only) - **4th** [Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) - **6th** [Tangling Creepers](/Spells.aspx?ID=331) (×2) - **7th** [Shifting Sand](/Spells.aspx?ID=586) (×2) - **8th** [Earthquake](/Spells.aspx?ID=95) (×2), [Summon Animal](/Spells.aspx?ID=316) - **Constant (8th)** [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) **Change Shape** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The taiga yai takes on the appearance of a [taiga giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=680). This doesn't change their Speed or Strike attack and damage. **Return to Nature** ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The taiga yai commands underground plant roots to drag a creature within 60 feet into the earth. The target must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or be [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1d4 rounds. After this time, the creature is buried; it is [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20), begins to [suffocate](/Rules.aspx?ID=468), and takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage each round they remain buried. To escape either while immobilized or grabbed, the creature must succeed at a DC 35 [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) check or an adjacent ally must succeed at a DC 33 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to pull them out.
Oni loners More so than other oni, taiga yais prefer seclusion or the company of evil beasts and wicked fey over that of other humanoids. They often befriend carnivorous animals, frequently partnering with apex predators such as bears and lions.
